name: 李鎮宇
objective:
As a 3rd year course in marketing research, this course is designed to

1.　　Introduce the role, scope, process and fundamental concepts of marketing research
2.　　Provide an understanding of research methodology and its implementation (using R)
3.　　Support the student to do a real marketing research project
schedule:
1. National Holiday
2. Introduction to Marketing Research: Defining Problem and Design 
3. Research Design: Qualitative and Survey Approaches
4. National Holiday
5. Researching Product Concept
6. Researching Customer Problems
7. Analytical Attributes Research
8. EMBA Joint Session 1: Harvard Case
9. Midterm week - Due: Case Report
10. Product and Launch Research 
11. Research Design
12. Questionnaire Design
13. EMBA Joint Session 2: Case Presentation
14. SAS Vaya
15. Sales Forecasting and Analysis
16. Product Protocal
17. Project Presentation Week
18. Exam week: Turn in final project
scorePolicy:
20% Participation, homework, quizzes
15% Assignment 1: Marketing Case Report (EMBA Group)
20% Presentation 1: Research & project presentation (EMBA Group)
15% Assignment 2: Marketing research design (Individual)
30% PPT Report (Individual)
100% Total
materials:
Core marketing research skills:
Naresh K. Malhotra, Marketing Research: An Applied Orientation, Pearson Education, 2020.

Applying marketing research to the product lifecycle:
C. M. Crawford, C. A Di Benedetto “New Products Management” 12th Edition, McGraw Hill Education, 2021
